item.title: Current Topics: Research Data Management Symposium
item.dc:creator: Erin Hayes
item.description:
Julia Kochi attended the Research Data Management Symposium hosted by the NN/LM Middle Atlantic Region. The Symposium was 1 ½ days and very practical. The first day started off with more “big sky” presentations, and only one of the presenters was affiliated with a library. The second half of the ...

Read moreCurrent Topics: Research Data Management Symposium

item.title: Improvement to the Library Home Page
item.dc:creator: Erin Hayes
item.description:
Notice anything different about library.ucsf.edu? In an effort to make our home page simpler and easier to use (see the Web Project Team’s guiding principles, posted in February), we’ve consolidated many of the links on the home page into one simple “top 10” list, which we’re calling Popular Links. Why ...

Read moreImprovement to the Library Home Page

item.title: UCSF’s 150th Anniversary: Many Faces, One Mission Project
item.dc:creator: Erin Hayes
item.description:
Be a part of UCSF’s 150th anniversary celebration by joining the “Many Faces, One Mission” project! All you have to do is say why you love UCSF and submit your photo to 150@support.ucsf.edu Read more about the project. Your short comment and photo can be featured on the upcoming anniversary ...

Read moreUCSF’s 150th Anniversary: Many Faces, One Mission Project

item.title: Current Topics: Educause Learning Initiative, ALA Midwinter Conference
item.dc:creator: Erin Hayes
item.description:
Jim Munson attended the Educause Learning Initiative 2014 Annual Meeting. “The Educause Learning Initiative is where teaching and learning professionals come to learn, lead, collaborate and share.” Main themes were assessment of student learning, blended & online learning, academic transformation, digital literacies, and the evaluation of instructional innovations. Evaluating Learning ...

Read moreCurrent Topics: Educause Learning Initiative, ALA Midwinter Conference

item.title: Current Topics: Society of American Archivists, An Event Apart
item.dc:creator: Erin Hayes
item.description:
Rachel Taketa attended the Annual Meeting of the Society of American Archivists (August 2013). Rachel was a panelist on “Session 408 – The Web of Sites” along with Olga Virakhovskaya of the Bentley Library at the University of Michigan, and Jennifer Wright of the Smithsonian Archives. • Rachel discussed the ...

Read moreCurrent Topics: Society of American Archivists, An Event Apart

item.title: Current Topics: Photoshop World
item.dc:creator: Erin Hayes
item.description:
Sean Gabriel McClelland attended the Photoshop World conference on September 4-6. His most notable takeaways from the event include: • The Adobe Create Suite of applications is shifting to a subscription model only. The “everything price” is $50/month, which seems expensive, but includes their entire series of industry standard applications, ...

Read moreCurrent Topics: Photoshop World

item.title: Current Topics: Portland Moodle Moot
item.dc:creator: Erin Hayes
item.description:
Brian Warling attended the Portland Moodle Moot in early August. Here are some highlights. Many of the presentations are available at: http://www.moodlerooms.com/moot/portland-moot/home The Moot kicked off with a presentation by Martin Dougiamas, Moodle’s founder and CEO. Moodle HQ is based in Perth, as is Martin, so he gave his presentation ...

Read moreCurrent Topics: Portland Moodle Moot

item.title: Library Hours Page Has a New Look
item.dc:creator: Erin Hayes
item.description:
We’ve made some changes to the Library Hours page: http://www.library.ucsf.edu/visit/hours This new calendar view should make it easier to see holidays, closures, reduced summer hours, etc. (If you scroll to September 2, you can see that Labor Day shows as “closed.”) The hours for individual departments/desks appear underneath the main ...

Read moreLibrary Hours Page Has a New Look

item.title: Current Topics: Handheld Librarian Conference, Rare Books School, and ALA
item.dc:creator: Erin Hayes
item.description:
Leslie Kleinberg viewed the panel discussion “Responsive Web Design,” part of the Handheld Librarian online conference on June 19. The main points were: Websites must be designed for a broad range of screen sizes and devices. Stop thinking about the “mobile web” vs. the “desktop web.” It’s just the web, ...

Read moreCurrent Topics: Handheld Librarian Conference, Rare Books School, and ALA

item.title: Please note that we’ve made some changes to…
item.dc:creator: Erin Hayes
item.description: Please note that we’ve made some changes to the Scholarly Publishing area of the website. You can now find all related pages under the SERVICES menu (it was previously under the HELP menu). Let me know if you have any questions.
